reviews.text: Sebelum menikmati keindahan pulau derawan, kita juga harus berkunjung ke salah satu objek wisata hutan mangrove di kecamatan tanjung batu, terdapat traking brige sepanjang 1,3 km dan pemandangan yg sejuk saat berada di dalam hutan ini

reviews.title: wisata edukasi
reviews.text: di sini  kita bias belajar mengenal ekosistem pesisir dan aneka jenis mangrove. pemandanganya sangat bagus dan cocok buat menenangkan pikiran dan untuk rilex. di sini juga ada pusat informasi mangrovenya yang bias kita kunjungi. ada pemandanganya juga.. di lokasi ini sangat bersih dan asri, pemandangan yang begitu indah perpohonan nanhijau tanah yang subur.

reviews.title: Wisata Edukasi dan Konservasi
reviews.text:
Disini kita bisa belajar aneka jenis mangrove dan bisa mengenal ekosistem pesisir. Sekaligus belajar tentang konservasi alam pesisir.
Pemandangannya sangat bagus dan cocok buat menenangkan pikiran.

Disini juga ada Pusat Informasi Mangrove nya yang bisa kita kunjungi. Ada pemandunya juga.

name: Biduk-Biduk Beach

reviews.title: Beautiful beach ever
reviews.text: I come here with my beloved friends, we drive from Balikpapan to Berau and continue to Biduk-biduk. Wow amazing, beautiful beach, clear water and we visited Kaniungan Island. I love this place.

reviews.title: Beautiful white sandy beach
reviews.text:
It took us 7 hrs from Berau city to get there. The road along the way is so badly damaged and some of the holes are pretty deep. So you have to be careful. But it will paid off by the beautiful beach and its white sand, its tall curvy coconut trees, and crystal clear water. 
There's some restaurant that offers really fresh seafood with rich taste. Another cons are it's quite hard to find a decent hotel. There's only some guest houses belong to locals. Not to mention the electricity that only generates from 6pm-6am.

reviews.title: white sandy beach
reviews.text: white sandy beach, virgin beach, we go there to have lunch seafood at Warung FIFA. Wide long seashore and you may found a lot of corals and seashell on the sands.

reviews.title: The scenery is quite beautiful
reviews.text:
The atmosphere is still very natural, not too many tourists who come to this place so that the natural conditions are still peacefully quite . Nothing to do at this place because not too many facilities available within surrounding area. Come, sit and enjoy the beauty of nature around the beach, that's all.

It takes about 7 hours by car from Tanjung Redeb - Berau to be able to get to this place, so think of it before you go. This is related to your day of travel.

reviews.title: Viewnya ruar biasaaaaaa
reviews.text: Serasa di florida kalo nyusuri jalan yang ada di sepanjang sisi pantai, pohon kelapanya tinggi banget, namun view lautnya yang ngangenin

reviews.title: mancing di Biduk Biduk
reviews.text:
dari Samarinda kami sengaja jalan laut selama 24 jam menuju perairan pantai Biduk Biduk, ikannya bervariasi, ada ruby, dogtooth, kerapu lumpur kertang yg besar, 
Selesai mancing kami main main di pantai Biduk Biduk, banyak sekali turis lokal yg juga liburan week end kesini

reviews.title: Pantai seperti hawai
reviews.text: Kalimantan timur juga punya tempat indah seperti biduk biduk ini, pantainya yang biru dan suasana yang tenang memberikan rasa nyaman bagi penikmat pantai

reviews.title: Pantai yang masih asri dengan view yang tiada banding
reviews.text: Tidak kalah dengan pemandangan di derawan, pantai biduk biduk ini membuat semua yang melihat akan jatuh cinta dan merasakan healing. Karena jarang wisatawan yang berkunjung membuat pantai ini sangat masih asri dan terlihat sangat original , selain itu pantai biduk biduk sangat bersih dan nyaman. Walaupun jauh dari ibukota tetapi ketika sampai di biduk biduk rasa lelah dalam perjalanan pun hilang dan terbayarkan dengan view alamnya yang sangat indah dan menawan. Pantai ini sangat cocok untuk orang orang yang senang dengan view pantai yang mempunyai pohon kelapa yang cantik, jika kita berlibur ke biduk biduk maka terasa kita seperti berlibur di luar negeri dengan pemandangan pasir putih bersih dan pohon kelapa disepanjangan pantai, terlebih lagi karena jarangnya kendaraan yang lewat udara dipantai ini masih sangat sejuk dan fresh untuk kita. Biaya berkunjung ke pantai biduk biduk pun tidak mahal, disepanjangan pantai kita bisa menyewa cottage atau tinggal di tempat penduduk sekitar, penduduknya pun ramah ramah yang menambah kesan kepuasan bagi yang berlibur ke pantai biduk biduk ini

reviews.title: subhanallah.. indahnya
reviews.text: Indahnya... pantai Biduk biduk. Perlu 8 jam dari Tanjung Redep (ibukota Kab Berau) dan terbayar dengan pemandangan yang memuaskan mata. Kerreenn. Subhanallah

reviews.title: View Bagus
reviews.text: sangat bagus pemandangan dipantai ini. Lokasi yang jauh dari tanjung redeb.. bagus mengajak keluarga berlibur disini.

reviews.title: Pantai Biduk - Biduk
reviews.text: Pantai yang indah. Disarankan mengunjungi pantai ini saat air laut surut sehingga bisa menikmati pasir putihnya yang indah.

reviews.title: lovely beach
reviews.text: Jelajahi seluruh bagian berau dan tidak terkecuali pantai biduk-biduk. Suasana tenang, hamparan pasir, pohon kelapa yg tinggi2, dan sesekali melihat sapi, kambing atau kuda berkeliaran manja di pantai.

reviews.title: Sangat bagus
reviews.text: Disana anda akan disambut hamparan pasir putih dan pohon kelapa disebelah kiri jalan dan birunya lautnya sangat mempesona

reviews.title: Pantai wisata terbaik

reviews.title: Pantai yang indah
reviews.text:
Biduk-biduk adalah sebuah kampung di kecamatan Biduk-biduk, Kabupaten Berau, propinsi Kalimantan Timur. Secara geografis kampung (desa) Biduk-biduk terletak di Semenanjung Mangkalihat, yang berada di bagian timur laut pulau Kalimantan, menghadap ke Selat Makassar di sebelah timurnya. Pantai di Biduk-biduk berpasir putih bersih, dengan pohon nyiur yang berjajar di sepanjang garis pantai. Perahu-perahu kayu (biduk) nelayan berjajar di pagi hari, merupakan pemandangan yang layak diabadikan sesaat sebelum matahari terbit di seberang lautan. Saya sangat suka momen sunrise ini, frame demi frame masuk ke lensa kamera, semuanya bagus, tinggal milih foto yang terbaik dari sisi momen dan pencahayaan yang paling pas. Kalau mau hunting sunrise, bangunlah pagi-pagi pas adzan subuh. Siapkan sandal pantai atau sepatu kets, jangan lupa bawa kamera atau handphone, dan pastikan baterenya fully charge... supaya nggak nyesel nanti waktu jalan di sepanjang pantai Biduk-biduk. Satu hal yang disayangkan, kebersihan pasir putihnya kadang tercemar oleh sampah dan kotoran ternak. Pilih objek bidikanmu... saya paling suka motret pohon nyiur yang melengkung dengan background langit jingga dan lautan biru yang ada bayangan keemasan, mantap... Ada juga pohon bakau tunggal yang tampak manis ketika masuk ke frame kamera. Juga biduk nelayan yang lagi parkir di pantai... banyak, tinggal pilih yang "pose" nya pas...Saya pengin kembali ke pantai ini lagi. Kalau mau cari penginapan, coba Hotel Mayang Sari, dekat banget sama pantai dan beberapa tempat makan di situ. Pemilknya, pak Herman, sangat ramah dan tahu betul objek-objek menarik di sekitar Biduk-biduk. 
Biduk-biduk dapat dicapai dengan jalan darat dari Bontang sekitar 10 jam, melewati kota Sangatta, Bengalon, simpang Kaliorang, desa Kaubun, nyeberang sungai Karangan di penyeberangan GM, lewat kebun sawit, desa Batuputih, desa Tanjung Prapat, Tanjung Harapan, sampailah di desa Biduk-biduk. Bisa juga ditempuh dari Tanjung Redeb (Berau) melewati Talisayan dan Batu Putih, waktu tempuh sekitar 6 jam pakai mobil inova. Pelajari rutenya sebelum mulai perjalan !
Sesudah di Biduk-biduk, objek-objek yang layak dikunjungi yaitu Danau Dua Rasa "Labuan Cermin", Pantai Harapan, Pantai Biduk-biduk, Teluk Sulaiman, Pulau Kaniungan Besar, Pulau Kaniungan Kecil, Pulau Sigending (ngeliat monyet Belanda / bekantan), Teluk Sumbang, Air Terjun Bidadari. Kata pak Herman, masih banyak lagi tempat yang indah dan belum terekpos....nah lo...yang suka adventure pasti demen ni... Pokoknya pergi ke Biduk-biduk mantap dan nggak rugi gan...

reviews.title: Pasir putih dan nyiur disepanjang pantai
reviews.text:
Biduk2 terkenal dengan labuan cerminnya, tapi pantainya tidak kalah indah.
Pantai yg tenang,pasir putih,deretan nyiur sepanjang pantai keramahan dan kearifan lokal merupakan perpaduan pas untuk menikmati suasana pagi yang damai.

Berpakaianlah yg sopan saat dsini karena mayoritas penduduk adalah muslim.

Jangan lupa untuk mencoba kuliner bubur mie disini.

Salah satu kekurangan dari daerah ini adalah listrik yang hanya menyala dimalam hari dan tidak semua sinyal handphone bisa dipakai disini.

reviews.title: Matahari terbit di Biduk-biduk
reviews.text: Jadi, dalam rangka untuk meluluskan keinginan buat mengunjungi Labuan Cermin, saya dan teman sekantor yg sama2 perempuan nekat lanjut ke Biduk2 dr Derawan bia Berau. Perjalanannya lumayan yaak ternyataa ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ untung punya obat anti mabok sehingga perjalanan tergongcang2 menuju Biduk2 bisa dilalui dengan pules. Pak sopirnya bilang sih kami bakal sampai sekitar jam 5an sore dgn berangkat dr tengah kota Berau jam 1an, ternyata sampe sana udah jam setengah 7 sore. Kami menginap di penginapan Mayang Sari, penginapannya bersih dan nyaman. Pemiliknya juga baik banget, kami dibantu buat nyari travel buat ke Bontang besok paginya. Bonus utama di penginapan ini adalah letaknya yg berhadapan dengan pantai, jadi kita sengaja bangun pagi2, ngulet2 depan penginapan sambil nunggu matahari terbit. Saat2 menjelang matahari terbit itu rasanya tenaaaaang sekali, cuman ada bunyi2 laut. Pokoknya yg awalnya gak bisa move on, mungkin langsung bisa move on setelah menenangkan hati sambil liat matahari terbit di Biduk-biduk ini ðŸ˜ŠðŸ˜Š

address: Jl. HM Raden Ayoeb, Berau Indonesia

reviews.title: Modern Traditional Place But Out Of Town
reviews.text:
This is a clean and modern version of traditional market. Sell almost everything and so clean for a traditional market. A little bit out of town, 5km from Berau City center. 

To reach it you have to take a blue van and ask "pasar SAD". It cost IDR 5k till 10k oer perseon to get there. Don't go there after 5 or 6 PM because it's very difficult to get blue van after that time and you have no choice except take a walk home.

reviews.title: Covered market
reviews.text: This market is covered, which makes it a suitable attraction on a rainy day. Blue vans stop closeby, so visitors may find afforable transportation. But the marketstands have nothing much special to add to the offer of the regular shops. Although I have to say they do sell you a big bag of fresh ant-nests for a good price.

reviews.title: Biggest market in town. Clean surroundings.
reviews.text:
This market is a little out of the central part of Berau and this is one of the biggest markets I have seen. This is where all the locals go and if you are a foreigner, you may also be getting the "foreigner" price. It is divided into the  dry goods, wet goods as well as normal foodstuff. There is also a food court and small amusement park for kids. Everything is segregated nicely. 
If you want to buy cheaper stuff come 5am to 7am to catch the open market. The stalls are set up rent free so things are cheaper. If you go into the dry market, there are a lot of things. Rows of salted fish, beans sold in open bags, really big prawns etc, it is a nice experience just to walk through as well.

reviews.title: Pasar Kebanggaan Orang Berau
reviews.text: Lokasinya berada di kilo 5, dari bandara sekitar 10 menit, bangunannya luas, parkirannya juga cukup luas, pasar kering ada di bagian depan, sedangkan pasar basah ada di bagian belakang, menyediakan semua kebutuhan rumah tangga.

reviews.title: Pasar terlangkap dan murah di tanjung redeb berau
reviews.text: Pasar tradisional yang menggunakan konsep modern, harga2 murah, barang2 yg pun mulai dari perlengkapan rumah tangga, urusan makanan, baju, dll ada di sini, kawasan pasar yang luas dan tertata serta kebersihan yang dijamin. Pasar ini berada di suatu kompleks besar yg di bangun secara khusus sama pemerintah. Orang sekitar mengenal dengan sebutan lain yakni pasar kilo 5 karena letaknya yang berada di kilometer 5 kota Tanjung Redeb.

reviews.title: Pasar Besar
reviews.text: Pasarnya sangat besar, rapi dan bersih. Bisa hanya jalan-jalan saja melihat atau berbelanja dengan harga yang murah. Oleh2 yg biasa dibeli dari Berau adalah terasi kering yg bundar2 dan dibungkus daun kering, ebi, ikan asin ada di sini

reviews.title: modern
reviews.text: pasar nya modern, sudah terpisah antara pasar kering n pasar basah...pasar basahnya teratur, tertata rapi kiosnya, lorong nya lebar, atapnya tinggi jd gk sempit..oia harga makanan laut nya murahhh..hampir setengahnya harga jakarta :))

name: Merabu Village
ranking_subcategory: #5 of 18 things to do in Berau
subcategory_ranking: #5 of 18 things to do in Berau
ranking: #5 of 18 things to do in Berau
description: Merabu Village is located in Berau District. The village next to the Karst rocky mountains offers you the experience to see first hand the condition of the forest that is still awake. Uniquely is the Karst Forest that holds so many mysteries from the Lake without foundation, Caves with prehistoric relics, hollow mountain views, and much more.

reviews.title: 5 day passed so quickly
reviews.text: We spent five wonderful days at Merabu. Years ago the village decided to keep their forest and, as a village, open up to tourisme. Itâ€™s an inspiring story which gives hope for the future of North Kalimantan and how developoment and conservation can go hand in hand. We spent 4 nights in the villages in a homestay and two nights in the jungle, one at Njadeng Lake and another and Beloyot  caves. Two placese of amazing beauty in the middle of the forest. Being taken to these places by guides from the village felt like a gift and and made us grateful that people of Merabur shared their forest with us for these days. This is an adventurous, unforgettable and inspiring place to visits â€“ one of the best things we did during our trip.

reviews.title: Best part of my Kalimantan experience
reviews.text:
Expect the following:
- little tourists
- nice people
- basic to very basic facilities (no shower, sometimes no matras, no phone receiption)
- beautiful mid-long walks and boat tours through the jungle
- little English
- magical, unknown places
- 6 hours by car from both Bereau and Sangatta

Me and four groups have been traveling in Kalimantan for twelve days, and visiting this village was definitely the best part. First of all, our guides Ganesay and Nazarul were the best ever. These young, energetic guys showed us around for the days and afterwards brought us to Bereau. There they let us stay at their place for the night and have a party. They showed us the city and they slept on the floor so we could sleep in their beds.
The experience of Merabu itself was so good as well. First of all, the caves were really adventurous. You climb through these dark caves with venemous spiders and bats and the paintings were wonderful. The walk in the jungle was really beautiful as well.
Next we camped at a beautiful lake in the middle of the jungle. We went there by boat and foot, and it was stunning. Absolutely beautiful. We cooked our food on wood fire, swam in the lake, looked at the stars and fireflies and looked for nocturnal animals. The following day we went up early for a hike up hill. It was quite tough, because we hadn't had any matras to sleep on, but the view was one of the best. It really showed the jungle of Borneo.
In short: it is a unique experience, but expect some adventure!

reviews.title: Village stay at Merabu Forest
reviews.text:
great experience to support the village to safeguard their forests. You can find useful information in previous posts

We have done a similar itinerary to Paulina - absolutely amazing. I think 2 nights/ 3 days is more than enough: 1 day to settle in, second day you can do cave + lake, third day you can climb the mountain to see sunrise and back by lunch time. You can either stay the day at the village or leave same day.

When we went Franley was not at the village, so it was very difficult to communicate: I would strongly recommend having a translator downloaded on your phone!

reviews.title: Eco Homestay in the Jungle of Borneo
reviews.text:
If you are interested in visiting Merabu, but are not sure what you can do and visit: you can first read the inspiring travel report 'Merabu Go Forest' on colours-indonesia.

I highly recommend a visit to Merabu!! The people are very welcoming; although they don't speak English, they do their utmost best to accomodate you. The chief of the village, Franly Oley, can speak reasonable English, and it is possible to email him, so that he can arrange your visit to the village.

What can you do in Berau?
1. Meet the locals of the village; they are so friendly and they are very knowledgable of their forest and nature. They protect their area, and try to stimulate eco-tourism, as a source of income. 
2. Hike in the forest, climb Mount Ketapu where you have an amazing view over the limestone forest, camp in the forest; the village can provide a tent and a guide. 
3. Do a boat tour on the rivers in the forest. You can see a lot of monkeys; and even proboscis monkeys.
4. Take the boat and take a dip in the crystal blue Lake Nyadeng.

We first went to the Derawan Islands (also HIGHLY recommended, we stayed at Scuba Sangalaki, which was truly amazing), then Franly picked us up from Berau. We stayed 3 days in Merabu and finally Franly arranged us a ride from Merabu to Sangatta, where we visited Kutai National Park.

The prices are very transparant; and you can ask Franly for the latest update. It is more or less like this:
Village donation: 200K, 13 euro (fee for your whole stay)
Overnight: 200K, 13 euros (per stay)
Food: 25K per meal, 1.64 euro
Mandatory guide in the jungle from 7 am to 4 pm: 11 euros pp per day
Transport from Berau to Merabu: 1500K, 100 euro for 1 ride, taxi jeep from the village 
Transport from Merabu to Sangatta: 2000K, 130 euro for 1 ride, taxi jeep from the village
Boat trip to Lake Nyadeng: 200K, 13 euros
Boat trip Proboscis Monkey: 250K, 20 euros

The income of this, goes directly to the village, as well as the protection of their forest. Prices are fair and reasonable. The only high cost, was the transfer; but the trip was easily 6 to 9 hours; it was a jeep-like car; as the road to the village is quite sandy. There is no bus-option; so if you want to visit the village, it's best you contact Franly, so he can arrange everything for you!

Contact him via this forum; via their instagram account, or you can also find his number and email in the Lonely Planet of Borneo.

Kind regards, Pauline

reviews.text: Kampung merabu berada di kecamatan kelay, lumayan jauh dari pusat perkotaan kabupaten berau, pengalaman yang sangat mengesankan saat melakukan hiking di gunung gunung kars dan menikmati indahnya pemandangan kars saat pagi hari layaknya megeri diatas awan

reviews.title: went multiple times.
reviews.text:
wow just beautiful and crystal clear.
Great place to go spend a day with friends.

so refreshing. canâ€™t wait to go back

reviews.title: what a view
reviews.text: although we have to face windy road to get here, but the view was amazing. the water so clear and you have to take photos with the boat so it can be mirroring the reflection (to show how clearly the water is - that's what "Cermin" stands for - Mirror)

reviews.title: quite relaxing
reviews.text: actually, who doesnt like mirror moving on ur face... exactly that i feel that time, cold water, and relaxing, tips, do not come in holyday season. so crowded.

reviews.title: Weekend Trip
reviews.text: Wonderful nature place to visit. Avoid going on Friday. Beware of wild macaque they might come and check on your belongings.

reviews.title: Hidden peace spot
reviews.text: You should take a boat to go to this lake. Perfect timing when the suns blazing. Youâ€™ll get perfect photo bcs the sunlight through the water, just like its mirrored the boat.

reviews.title: hiden's paradise in berau east kalimantan
reviews.text:
hiden's paradise

it's not easy to get there, because the lake is on the opposite side of the ocean. You have to replace another boat to get there, after 3 hours from Derawan Island. located in Biduk Biduk village, Berau Regency, East Kalimantan 77373. Water in Labuan Cermin Lake is very unique, where the water contained has a fresh and salty taste. At the top of the water level the lake feels fresh, but when diving at the bottom of the lake, the water starts to feel salty.

Unfortunately, the local community cannot manage the trash on the dock, it takes 10 minutes to arrive at the lake, you can enjoy the virgin lake with very clear water like a mirror. a very useful trip, even though the sea was very bumpy during the trip to reach the nearest village. for women, it is recommended to wear closed clothing because the village where the dock is located, in an Islamic village, but when you are in a labuan cermin, you can use a bikini. Labuan cermin is a destination for photos on a boat or underwater and we recommend swimming across the lake if you want to take photos under water. Interesting activities that can be done on the lake include:

Swim

Snorkeling

And ride a boat

reviews.title: Swimming in a crystal-clear waters
reviews.text: Labuan Cermin is a very  beautiful place. You arrive by boat and you can swim in a blue crystal-clear water. This place is a paradise and it's surrounded from green hills. You can still see a big nature... but please, protect this amazing place!

reviews.title: Heaven on earth
reviews.text: How great is our God the creator of this universe. Thatâ€™s the first thing that come to my mind when I see this place. The water is so clear and blue, cold and fresh. The weather is so nice. Itâ€™s worth the trip. We enjoy this place so much. But, to keep this place beautiful and honour the Great Creator, please accept my advice, take nothing but pictures and memories , leave nothing but footprints.

reviews.title: Its Unique Two-Flavor Lake Water
reviews.text:
Felt the amazing experience in Labuan Cermin Lake which famous for its unique two-flavor lake water, fresh on the surface and salty at the bottom, with different types of fish coexisting alongside one another. 

Well, I honestly have to say that I fall in love with this place. Labuan cermin Lake is located in Biduk Biduk Region, Berau, East Borneo. Though everyone knows about this magical beautiful lake, but only some of them decide to go there, since it is quite hard to reach this place. Place where could be reached for more than 13hours from my hometown, Balikpapan. (by car)

Quite hard to reach this place. It's more because 6-8 hours will be spent from Sangatta to Biduk-biduk Region. For sure, it will be first problem for working person who only have free time on weekend or public holiday.

The road from Sangatta to Biduk-biduk would become your boring overland journey ever due to the winding and bumpy road with lack or almost no view you will experience. 
The overnight journey is too dark to see and feel the fresh air of Biduk-biduk area, but your morning would be welcome and paid by a calm atmosphere with straight tall coconut trees line up along the road and the clear blue sky combining the turquoise blue water on the coast.

I suggest you to not going on the weekend. I was going on the weekend. Due to the plenty visitors on the weekend, the boat would come more often which make the watter less clear and become turbid. 

For people who cannot swim, you guys are absolutely still can enjoy the Labuan Cermin, because there are swimming bans and life jackets rented on the pier. But, it will be more well-experienced if you can feel those magical fresh water which flows into the seawater trapped in the lake.

Well, It's still amazing for me to experience the fresh water on the surface and salt water 2 metres deeper. I was also wondering how it could be happened.

reviews.title: Great Lake But Too Touristy
reviews.text: Great clear lake, the water is cold!!! If itâ€™s too crowded with tourist, the water wonâ€™t look crystal clear as itâ€™s supposed to be! After you arrive in the location, purchase the ticket and wait for your turn, then take boat to the lake! You can also fly drone here!

reviews.title: The scenery and natural conditions are very natural
reviews.text: A very natural natural atmosphere is felt once you arrive in the area, so a long journey that takes more than six hours can be paid when viewing the natural atmosphere. But although the natural scenery is very beautiful, the travel time is very long and very draining. We must have a good physical condition and have enough time to be able to visit this place.

reviews.title: beautiful lake
reviews.text:
This beautiful lake located in bidukbiduk village its about 7 hours from berau by car. I was travel to bidukbiduk on May 2017 by innova with other 5 people. And we chase to get arrived at this lake around 12pm from talisayan. From talisayan it took about 2 hours to get bidukbiduk.
Nearby labuan cermin lake you will find white sandy bidukbiduk beach. This lake was being operated by local people and you must pay entrance fee and boat around hundred thousand rp.
It is a clear water lake and a bit difficult to swim deep. You will find boat rental and tires rental for swimming. Even the change room not really neat you may taking a shower and change your cloths nearby the parking area.

reviews.title: Nice Lake
reviews.text: I go there from Talisayan Village. From Talisayan Village to Labuan Cermin Lakes is about 2 hours driving by car. Labuan Cermin have a very clear water, like a mirror. You must go there!

reviews.title: Clear water, tranquil paradise
reviews.text:
The Labuan Cermin Lake is situated at Mangkalihat Peninsula, on East Kalimantan coastal line, near Biduk-biduk village, in Berau Regency. It can be reach from Tanjung Redeb approximately 6 hours by MPV car. Another route from Bontang takes 10 hours to get here. 
To enter Labuan Cermin Lake you have to go to ticket box at the pier. The ticketing staff would then arrange a motor boat transport for 5-8 people, cost you IDR 100.000,- two ways. Spend 1-2 hours minimum during the visit. Prepare yourself with bathing suit and towel; comfortable footwear; camera with water splash protection; drinks and cookies as you like. Live vest will be provided by the boat master. 
Enjoy the beautiful scenery and quiet surroundings of Labuan Cermin. I think it was the unique geologic setting that makes this place special. From the hinter land, there was a carst topography with caves and underground rivers. Several rivers flows to the sea, the fresh water meets salt water to create a unique turqoise-green color of very clear water surrounded by kart hills. 
Spend som time to swim and enjoy the clarity of the water... Use snorkle and googles to get better vision of the lake bottom. If you are lucky, you may find fish schools swimming near the lake bottom. Take your time, find beautiful spots, and explore.
Tips for taking photo: stand up on the boat and ask somebody to take the picture, with turqoise water on the foreground and forrested caves on the background. Make sure the boat image reflected by the lake water captured in the photo. Best time to visit is between 10 am to 2 pm.

reviews.title: Never on a peak season
reviews.text:
One of a few things i loved from my last trip to Derawan was that we stubbornly chose to visit this location even though it made us travel back and forth. Because we visited this mesmerizing hidden paradise, we need to woke up on 5am to set a sail on 6am and docked at 9.30am and rushed overland to catch a 13.00pm flight.

But it was worth every single heartbeat.

reviews.title: UNIQUE lake (2 taste of water) & habitat of Bekantan (rare endemic monkey)
reviews.text:
This lake is completely unique place.
Clear greeny water from the surface (so your picts will had a mirror effect on the water surface), cold water temp (about 25C), the water taste more fresh water on the surface (no fishes) & more salty near the bottom (had fishes), depth I duck dive into at the middle of the lake are about 7M.
The lake was surrounding by a forest where 3kinds (as what I saw) of monkey living there: [1] Bekantan (this one are endemic&rare; long nose, yellow brown fur, medium size). [2] small size, long tail, grey monkey. [3] small size, long tail, black monkey.
This place is MUST VISIT when you get into East Kalimantan area.
======
How to get there: [1]By boat: from Tanjung Redeb harbor (about 30mnts from BEJ airport) to Biduk2 village takes about 3H. But there're also charter speedboat from Derawan Island (may longer). [2]By charter car/public bus: from Tanjung Redeb city to Biduk-Biduk village (may take a day).
Where to stay: There are no hotel/resort there, but we can rent a room (w/ or w/o AC) & had eat at small food counter from the locals there. 
Things to bring: camera is a MUST! Snorkeling mask/google to explore the lake (the local rent it also), water for shower after swim on the lake, as they just had 2rooms either for toilet&changing room. Cash money, as quiet far from the village to reach ATM place.

reviews.title: Very clear water, great underwater
reviews.text:
Best time to visit this lake is about 11am-1pm where the sun makes the water so clear.
Local said it's 2 taste water, where the upperside is fresh water, and the downside is salt one.
Some branches and root could be good place to play and free dive underwater.

reviews.title: The Handsome lake
reviews.text: "This natural wonder is located in District Biduk-Biduk, Berau Regency, East Kalimantan (Borneo).  The best time to visit is in the morning from 9 am till 2 pm. I suggest not to visit during weekend because a bit crowded. This lake is very handsome because it have 1. crystal clear water 2. Two taste (salt and water) 3. green forest at surrounding area 4. Free of entry 5. close to other nature attraction such as: Sulaeman lake and Biduk-biduk Beach. 6. friendly people 7. managed by local community to ensure the safety and clean

reviews.title: Salt and fresh water Trap
reviews.text:
It is very clean lake with nice scenery. 
We can find salt and fresh water at that lake. 
To reach this place it takes 10 minutes by boat from nearest harbour or 2 hours from airport. 
Anyhow some motel and resort are available..

reviews.title: Serene and Beautiful!
reviews.text:
The Labuan Cermin or Mirror Lake is a 6- hour drive from Berau.It is located in Biduk Biduk village.I You can get here using a car as public transpo is very limited and hard to find. You can have a chartered car or a regular one. Of course, a  chartered car is very expensive because it can bring you to Biduk-Biduk even if you are the only one so I opted for a regular way to go there as I was a solo traveler.The road to the village is hilly and winding , the road side is lined with trees and during the time I was traveling it was so hot but the cloud formation is awesome! But sadly, most parts are deforested to pave the way for palm tree plantations.You will pass the town of Talisayan where the whale sharks are.
The driver that I contacted was very helpful. He helped me find the hostel as most of the hostels are full due to the surge of local tourists during the Christmas holiday. He toured me around his village, he is a native by the way and even brought me to the Pelabuan Lake the next morning as my hostel is very far from the lake. Most hostels are  approximately 15 mins via motorbike from the lake and there is no angkut , maybe there is an ojek but I did not see one.I stayed at Mirante Hostel, most hostels are basic, ranging from 100-200 per night. There is no hotel in this area yet. 
 Biduk Biduk is a coastal village, the sand is beige and every afternoon there is a high tide and during the morning the tide is low.I witnessed a wonderful sunrise here by  the way right accross my hostel. People are friendly, the food is cheap and good. 
The lake itself is beautiful. I  was one of the first visitors during that day. Better come there around 8am because the lake's water is not yet disturbed and not yet noisy :). 
The water is  transparent and enchanting. You can see fallen trees, fishes, rock formation under even you are just on a boat. The water is a bit cold but refreshing and the "dua rasa" or two flavors  is true. I tried it lols :) I swam and snorkel until my toes are soggy.  My visit here was truly a good one. Might come back soon!!!

P.S. You may contact Pak Rudy (081350086375) if you  need assistance going to Pelabuan Cermin.Call or text him 1 or 2 days before your visit. I think he can pick you up from the airport or Tanjung Batu if you came  from Derawan Islands.

reviews.title: Short weekend trip
reviews.text: A wonderful place to the whale shark. Departing from Derawan early morning before sunrise. Slightly bumpy speed boat ride but really worth it for those who have not seen the worlds biggest fish.

reviews.title: Whale shark hunting
reviews.text: Take a boat by 5am to go to hunting spot. Well its not like we really do whale shark hunting. The whale sharks get used to feed by fisherman on â€˜the hunting spotâ€™ so they will come when its time. No need to worry to snorkle next to them, theyâ€™re friendly somehow.

reviews.title: Good for Whaleshark spotting
reviews.text: From Berau you can reach the small village of Talisayan. It will be a bumby ride, and you have to consider a rivate car with driver. Talisayan itselve has a nice little boulvard and pier. Compared to Derawan the prices are okay, and the atmosphere is less focused on tourism and more relaxed. At the Talisayan hotels or harbour you can ask for a boattrip to go Whaleshark spotting. Keep in mind Whaleshark spotting can only be done in the right month and time (late night/early morning).

name: Baitul Hikmah Great Mosque
ranking_subcategory: #3 of 18 things to do in Berau
subcategory_ranking: #3 of 18 things to do in Berau
ranking: #3 of 18 things to do in Berau

reviews.title: Beautiful mosque
reviews.text:
Ah this is seems small of Mosque in Abu Dhabi...
I like design of this mosque.
Located in town and as touristic have to visit even not for Moslem.

reviews.title: beautiful green Mosque
reviews.text: the atmosphere of the mosque is quiet and comfortble for pray. Baitul Hikmah is magnificent building with sturdy tower. A special Architecture Design blend with Combination green and white color make it looks perfect and elegant.

reviews.title: Impressive and elegant!
reviews.text: Beautiful and tasteful mosque, painted in attractive pastel green and white.  Nice setting and attractive grounds.  Well worth a short visit.

reviews.title: Big, beautiful and amaze
reviews.text:
A mosques were very large and beautiful, especially the architectural design is extraordinary nice. Looks magnificent and graceful to a mosque in the district region of Berau.

As one of the landmarks of Tanjung Redeb, preferably cleanliness the yard and parking lot should always be well maintained and clean.

reviews.title: Landmark in Berau - beautiful green mosque
reviews.text:
It was amazing when we got to Berau that we would see such a beautiful mosque. It is very big and impressive, considering the size of Berau. The mosque is inside a large compound and even has a radio station inside. It is painted a lovely emerald green colour and looks very tranquil especially at night when the mosque is lit up. It is not as luxurious as some of the mosques I have seen in the Middle East but it is bright, marble flooring inside and a large chandelier. The windows are these geometric shapes with stained glass which gives a lovely tranquil feel inside the mosque. 
There are four minerats. The whole place was locked down so we approached the office who kindly opened up the elevator. The tower is 70 metres high and can look over the whole of Berau. This is the highest point of the city so we can see all the three towns that make up Berau.

reviews.title: Masjid megah di berau
reviews.text:
Masjid jami yang sangat megah, menjadi salah satu ikon kebanggan masyarakat berau
Terdapat menara yang menjulang tinggi di samping masjid ini, dan saya sangat senang beribadah di dalam masjid ini karena suasana dan kenyamanan nya

reviews.title: Megah dan Indah
reviews.text: Subhanallah... megah dan indah masjid di bhumi Borneo ini. Strategis dan mudah dijangkau. Banyak disinggahi orang yang dalam perjalanan.

reviews.title: Masjid Agung kota Tanjung Redeb
reviews.text: Masjid ini merupakan masjid terbesar di Berau dan letaknya tak jauh dari kantor Bupati Berau. Bentuknya seperti masjid di Turki dengan bulatan besar dan empat menara, ditambah satu menara besar di samping masjid. Suasananya cukup adem walau di luar cuaca panas terik karena tingginya atap masjid.

reviews.title: Masjid utama berau
reviews.text: Masjid kebanggaan kota berau yg terus menerus berkembang dan tak kalah indah dengan masjid2 lainnya. Lapangan parkir luas dan dikelilingi pagar. Nyaman utk melakukan ibdah sholat di sini.

reviews.title: Masjid hijau yang indah
reviews.text:
Pulang dari labuan cermin tak sengaja, rombongan kami mampir bersholat ashar disini sebelum menuju tanjung batu. Tempat berwudhu disediakan di tiap sudut masjid, hanya saja toilet diletakkan terpisah.

Masjid ini sangat bersih nan asri, mukena2 juga tertata rapi didalam lemari yang tersedia. Area parkir juga cukup luas.
Pastikan memakai pakaian yang sopan saat memasuki masjid.

reviews.title: Masjid terbesar di kalimantan timur
reviews.text: Kota kabupaten berau yang tenang terasa lebih menentramkan ketika singgah di masjid terbesar di kaltim ini.. kicauan burung menjadi latar suara yang merelaksasi..

reviews.title: Mesjid yang Besar dan Indah.
reviews.text: Mesjid yang sangat bagus dan indah untuk kota Tanjung Redeb - Berau, dapat dijadikan tujuan wisata kota dan tempat untuk berfoto sebagai bukti telah mengunjungi kota Tanjung Redeb. Kebersihan dan kerapihan pada area sekitar mesjid harus tetap dijaga agar keindahannya tetap terlihat dengan sempurna.

reviews.title: Warna yang kontras
reviews.text: Mesjid ini besar dan sangat jelas terlihat karena warnanya yang hijau. sanagt bagus untuk meliat masjid ini di sore hari dengan latar belakang sunset.

reviews.title: tempat wudhu tidak strategis
reviews.text: besar bersih dan nyaman, namun tempat wudhunya kurang strategis karena harus pakai sandal melewati batas suci. dan toilet jauh

reviews.title: indah
reviews.text: habis ngopi sore hari di tepian berau, melipir ke masjid utk sholat maghrib..masjidnya luas, nuansa hijau, interiornya mewah, bersih, tidak panas, jamaah nya banyakk juga...alhamdulillah. tenangg deh sholat di sini

reviews.title: Megah Sekali!!
reviews.text: Saya mengunjungi masjid ini di kala sholat Maghrib, bangunannya sangat megah dan besar. Beruntung jamaahnya juga lumayan banyak. Setiap Maghrib sholat jama'ah ditayangkan di TV lokal Berau.

subcategory_ranking: #4 of 18 things to do in Berau
ranking: #4 of 18 things to do in Berau

reviews.title: Huge busy river
reviews.text:
Main river in berau....connected to the ocean. 
Lots of crocodiles  in certain areas. NOT FOR SWIMMING.
The river is mainly used for tranportaing coals ..and people crossing to other area. It leads to derawan from berau as well

reviews.title: Artery of life for Berau!
reviews.text: Just a good-sized river slicing through the center of Berau. Lots of boat plying the waters and enthusiast food vendors in the evening.  Possible to sit by the river on plastic chairs and enjoy the world go by.

reviews.title: My Fave Spot to Watch the Sunset
reviews.text: This river runs through the city. There's path alongside the river where you can walk and enjoying the view. The sunset view is unforgettable. This place is full of hawker stall during the night and quite packed of locals who spend their leisure time and hangout here. The stalls sell various kind of food,from fried rice, satay, toast, juice, etc.

reviews.title: Good
reviews.text: Big cargoships passing by. Clean Boulevard. Foodstands in the evening. Blue vans can take you there during daytime.

reviews.title: Sunset drink
reviews.text: There's a long row of food and drink stalls along the riverbank, which make a nice place to stop for a sunset drink (non-alcoholic, of course). They all seem pretty identical in their offerings. Doesn't seem to be any shade, so wouldn't want to go there in the mid-day sun.

reviews.title: Beautiful sunset
reviews.text: Segah river is the major waterways for the district of Berau. The river is used mainly for transportation of coal for exports. Segah riverside is a favourite hotspot for locals for leisure and night hawker stalls.

reviews.title: Energising, alive, and quite famous for the Local Citizens
reviews.text:
This river is the heart of the town of Tanjung Redeb - Berau of East Kalimantan.

Phinisi the traditional cargo boats, Tug boat which towing the barge with fully load of coal, speedboats, cargo ships, ketinting and more are cruising along the Segah River and becoming nice attraction to see during the daylight. The food carts along the river bank bring out the townspeople and it is an eyeopener to viewing the life of this town. Watching a storm over the river with the lightening is awesome and really  enjoyed to walk along this very colorful river bank.

reviews.title: Energising, relaxing, active, alive
reviews.text:
The Segah is a working river, alive with business as the barges move up and down. The river gives energy in its movement and in a strange way also gives relaxation.
I would suggest taking the time to sit at the rivers edge and drink in the movements... and allow it to find the rhythms in your own life.

reviews.title: nice to sit and reflect as sun sets
reviews.text: sitting by the river in Berau is a great way to unwind after a busy day. Watching the river boats and watching the sun slowly set is a good way to relax

reviews.title: A Working River
reviews.text: This river is the heart of the town of Berau.  Fishing boats, pleasure boats, cargo and more.  The food carts along the river front bring out the townspeople and it is an eyeopener to viewing the life of this town.  Watching a storm over the river with the lightening is awesome and we enjoyed our walk along this very colorful riverfront.

reviews.title: The river runs through it
reviews.text: So this is the river that runs around the entire town. It is a bit dirty so the water is brownish. However, it is very nice to have this river run through the centre of the town. There are barges that fill the river and its nice to take a walk along the river especially in early morning. The view of the sunrise along the river is absolutely beautiful.

reviews.title: Sungai transportasi...
reviews.text: Sungai ini memang merupakan jalur transportasi terutama batu bara, sehingga banyak kapal kapal muatan yang besar besar, terkadang merusak keindahan sungainya sendiri...

reviews.title: Segah River. Sepanjang Berau - luas dan panjang.
reviews.text: Sungainya panjang dan lebar. Barangkali ratus km. Airnya tenang. Banyak berlabuh kapal batubara. Lewat percis di wilayah Berau. Orang asli Berau menyebut Sungai Teluk Bayur. Malam hari banyak kaki lima untuk santai . Nyaman dan relax

reviews.title: Sungai Pembelah Kerajaan di Berau
reviews.text: Sungai ini berada di tepian kota Tanjung Redeb, Berau dan dulunya merupakan batas kerajaan Gunung Tabur dan Sambaliung. Dari sungai ini kita bisa berlayar ke laut lepas dengan kapal besar karena sungainya lebar dan dalam. Sore hingga malam hari sungainya ramai oleh pedagang kaki lima dan pengunjung yang sedang menikmati suasana sungai. Sayang warna sungainya kecoklatan dan tampak kotor oleh sampah.

reviews.title: Unik dan menawan
reviews.text: Pada awalnya sungai ini terlihat kecil, tetapi ternyata sungai ini sangatlah besar dan dalam, karena berlalulalang kapal dari perusahaan tambang, unik dan sangat menarik,melihat kapal laut disekitar

reviews.title: Melihat kapal pengangkut batubara
reviews.text: Pusat kota Berau berada di pinggiran sungai Segah ini. Ada perahu lokal yang menawarkan paket mengelilingi sungai Segah ini dengan harga murah. Pemandangan kapal pengangkut (tongkang) yang mengangkut batubara juga cukup menarik.

reviews.title: Tempat Favorite Menikmati Sunset
reviews.text:
Sungai segah, Tepian dan pusat jajanan dermaga Teratai merupakan satu kesatuan.

Membelah kota Berau Sungai segah dan tepian merupakan tempat favorite warga Berau untuk Sejenak keluar dari hiruk pikuk penatnya kegiatan sehari2.

Di daerah tepian dermaga Teratai merupakan lokasi terbaik untuk menyaksikan Sunset. Dengan siluet tugboat kapal penarik Batubara yang sedang berlabuh menunggu giliran.

Suasanya ini Sangat cocok dinikmati dengan secangkir kopi manis dan pisang epe.

Sayang nya di tepian sungai sedang kondisi gorong2 yang kurang bersih, ketika sedang ngemil2, banyak tikus dan Kecoa yang mundur-mandir.

reviews.title: santai asyik
reviews.text: Salah satu tempat santai yg asyik di berau dan wajib dikunjungi. View keren pada pagi hari sblm jam 7an dan sore hari jam 5-6 sore utk menikamti sunrise dan sunset. Mau ngemil2 manja atau makan berat juga tersedia, banyak penjual di sepanjang tepi sungai segah tapi jgn lupa jaga kebersihan dan keamanan ya.

reviews.title: Beau fleuve colorÃ©
reviews.text: Le plus Ã©tonnant est d'abord la couleur orangÃ©e de ce fleuve large et puissant. TrÃ¨s intÃ©ressant. L'un des ponts ressemble Ã©trangement Ã  celui du film " le pont de la riviÃ¨re Kwai". A voir.

reviews.title: Pesona tepi sungai dengan aneka kuliner
reviews.text:
Datang ke berau, tak lengkap jika tidak berkunjung ke tepian. Meski rombongan hanya transit melepas lelah sejenak dari perjalanan panjang biduk biduk menuju tanjung batu  kami cukup puas meski hanya lima menit disini. Bersantai ditepian sungai segah, hanya waktu kurang tepat karena pada pukul 16.00 waktu setempat para pedagang ditepian baru mulai menata dagangannya. 

Minusnya disini, para pedagang mematok harga makanan yg tinggi untuk kelas kaki lima. Jadi sebelum membeli makanan dan minuman, bertanyalah dahulu kepada penjualnya daripada terkaget2 saat membayar tagihan bon dibelakang.

name: Mount Tabur Sultanate Palace
ranking_subcategory: #7 of 18 things to do in Berau
subcategory_ranking: #7 of 18 things to do in Berau
ranking: #7 of 18 things to do in Berau
address: Jl. Kuran, RT 03, Gunung Tabur, Berau Indonesia

reviews.title: good for short visit
reviews.text: Good for short visit. No entrance fee asked. Helpfull free of charge guide present. Clean toilets available.

reviews.title: Berau Legacy
reviews.text:
This museum was once the palace of Gunung Tabur Sultanate, built around 1810 AD. The building complex consists of main palace in the middle and smaller buildings at the surrounding. It was kept clean and beautiful. The museum attendant explained that the original palace was destroyed by NICA army. The building we visited was the restoration of the palace. Inside the palace we observed the sultan's throne, guest room, family room, bride room, and some other rooms to display the artefacts. 

A small palace but nice and tidy, worth the time to visit.

reviews.title: Museum or Sultan Castle
reviews.text: There's nothing to see at this place, no information to see and nobody to find to ask. Even information board nothing to find as well. All the doors and windows were closed.

reviews.title: Meet the sprightly 99 year princess
reviews.text:
Gunung Tabur is about 20's drive from Berau or 5 minutes by speedboat; the reason is because we have to cross the river by this bridge is a little bit further then the central of town. 

This was actually rebuilt as a temporary shelter after Japanese world war. However, it is very charming, no thanks to the 99 year old princess who lives in the smaller house. She welcomed us to a simple house where she lives with her 103 bedridden sister. They are the children of the last king and their brother was killed by the Japanese during World War 2. They live in the smaller house filled with memorabilia of their live as princesses such as their family heritage and family photos. 

Both the smaller house and the museum have a yellow theme. Once we enter the museum, we are in the throne room. Next to it, there are various bedrooms, all with yellow bedsheets. The kitchen is interesting - they show how they use to filter the water previously. There is a baby room and they explained how they weighed their babies with cooling fruits on the other side. There are also armoury which they used such as the canons and ceremonial knives. There are also snippets of ordinary life such as dayak beading. 

Would recommend a visit to this place as an introduction to the history of this area.

reviews.title: Mengenal Berau lewat Museum
reviews.text:
Mempelajari sejarah perkembangan kerajaan di Berau lewat museum gunung Tabur
Pembelajaran ini cukup efektif untuk saya yg pertama kali berkunjung ke Berau 
Di sekitar museum juga terdapat tempat tinggal dari keturunan kerajaan gunung tabur, termasuk juga ada komplek pemakaman raja2
Keraton kesultanan gunung Tabur ini dikenal juga sebagai museum Batiwakkal

reviews.title: Saksi Sejarah di Berau
reviews.text:
Ini salah satu saksi Sejarah di kabupaten Berau. Saksi penyebaran agama Islam di sana.
Banyak informasi sejarah dari sini. Namun perlu perhatian pemerintah agar lebih terawat lagi

reviews.title: Musium Sejarah Kerajaan di Berau
reviews.text: Musium ini terletak di seberang pusat kota yang dipisahkan oleh Sungai Segah. Dahulu musium ini adalah istana kerajaan Gunung Tabur yang menguasai Kalimantan bagian utara hingga ke Kinabatangan (Malaysia). Hanya dalam perjalanannya terjadi perpecahan sehingga timbul dua kerajaan, yang satunya bernama Sambaliung. Di sini tersimpan berbagai peninggalan khas kerajaan seperti singgasana, tempat tidur, pelaminan, dan dispenser jaman dulu. Kita cukup memberikan sumbangan sekedarnya untuk masuk ke musium.

reviews.title: Mengenal sejarah kerajaan di berau lebih dalam
reviews.text:
Begitu datang ke tempat ini, nuansa kuning sangat kental sekali yang menandakan kejayaan seperti warna emas. 
Di dalam ruangan2nya kita dapat melihat peninggalan2 kesultanan yang masih terawat dengan baik.
Kalaupun ada hal yg ingin ditanyakan, ada guide yang ramah-ramah yang siap untuk menjelaskan.
Sangat disarankan untuk yang ingib mengetahui sejarah tentang kerajaan di berau.

reviews.title: Mengenali sejarah di Berau
reviews.text: Museumnya cukup kecil, namun beberapa benda bersejarah wajib untuk di lihat. Tiket masuk cukup murah

reviews.title: Kesultanan Berau
reviews.text: Kalau mau tau tentang sejarah berau sebaiknya kesini. letaknya tidak jauh dengan keraton sambaliung.

reviews.title: museum in berau city
reviews.text: sebenarnya museumnya bagus sih, cuman masih belum terlalu banyak ditata dan dibagusin lagi gitu, kalau lebih dibagusin lagi bagus juga untuk wisatawan asing yang singgah ke berau bisa mampir-mampir lihat. jadi tau deh sejarah Berau bagaimana..

reviews.title: Salah satu keraton yang masih aktiv
reviews.text: Berbeda dengan keraton Sambaliung, keraton ini masih aktiv karena salah satu dari keturunan kesultanan masih tinggal disana. Di tempat ini kita masih bias melihat berbagai peninggalan kesultanan. seperti museum mini.

reviews.title: Bagus!!
reviews.text:
Istana ini terletak di seberang sungai segah, Berau
Bisa ditempuh dengan menyeberang menaiki ketinting atau harus memutar melewati jembatan ke arah jalan menuju Tj.Batu
Ornamen Melayu klasik menghiasi kraton ini.
Cocok untuk para pecinta sejarah jaman raja-raja dahulu terutama di bumi Borneo

reviews.title: Peninggalan Budaya yang tersisa
reviews.text: Istana Kesultanan Gunung Tabur terletak di seberang sungai Segah, tepatnya di jalan Kuran RT 03, kecamatan Gunung Tabur, Berau, Kalimantan Timur. Istana ini mempunyai halaman yang cukup luas dengan bangunan besar yang sudah dijadikan museum oleh pemda setempat. Di istana ini masih bermukim seorang Ratu yang berusia sekitar 90 tahun namun masih terlihat cantik dan bugar. Saya sempat menemui beliau dan ngobrol sekitar setengah jam. Di istana ini tersimpan peninggalan budaya Kalimantan Timur dan foto2 para Raja sesuai silsilah kesultanan. Hal yang menarik bagi saya adalah Sang Ratu dapat berbicara bahasa jawa dengan sangat fasih dan beliau pun memakai pakaian jawa (kebaya). Menurut ceritera bahwa beliau pernah diasingkan ke Yogyakarta oleh Belanda, dan tinggal di istana Yogyakarta selama hampir sepuluh tahun.

went with friends from teluk sumbang and has a great day .  snorkeling is fantastic.  first saw a turtle then 2 wait no 3 wait no 4.  wow.  all day turtles and amazing fish and coral.  

then a stop for a great lunch, some uno , some relaxation and back to snorkeling.

reviews.title: Heaven on earth I had been searching for
reviews.text:
No word can describe the beauty of the place!
I was these simply there by accident n crashing myself with HPI team (indonesia official tour guide), i'm not their team but it was an experience I never regret. 

The place is not yet well-known so there aren't many people in the island except some visitors n some local fisher families, so the nature surrounding the place is not artificially made. 

The water was cristal clear n there are still lots of sea turtles roaming around the place to find a nest to lay their eggs.
The waves are calm n perfect to do snorkeling. 

A must visit place!

reviews.title: Tujuan wisata baru di biduk2
reviews.text: 20mnit menggunakan kapal boat kecil dari teluk sulaiman ke P. Kaniungan besar. Disini sudah terdapat beberapa homestay yg disewakan penduduk. Ada 1 homestay yang lumayan besar menyediakan 3 rumah2 kecil yang disewakan untuk pengunjung. Apabila ingin snorkeling dan juga mengadakan acara sangat tepat memilih kaniungan besar sebagai tempat bersantai bersama keluarga dibanding dengan biduk2. Karena private island nya lebih berasa. Disini juga menyediakan penyewaan alat snorkeling dan juga ban sharga 20rb/jam. Utk snorkeling jangan harap ada FIN tapi kalian akan diberikan sepatu karet ala crocs (hahaha).

reviews.title: Pulau Eksotis yang menawarkan keindahan alam dan satwa liar
reviews.text: Pulau ini sangat menarik hati, dari perairan lautnya yang bening, keindahan terumbu karangnya, keindahan panorama bawah laut, satwa liar seperti penyu, lumba - lumba dan paus.

reviews.title: Cantik!
reviews.text: Pulau cantik , bersih, dengan air laut yg jernih, banyak karang cantik dan binatang laut yg bisa dipandangi tanpa harus menyelam ke dasar. Di sepanjang bibir pantai terdapat banyak keong dan bintang laut untuk diamati. Pengalaman yg menarik bisa berkunjung ke pulau ini.

reviews.title: Pulau Kaniungan Besar, Berau
reviews.text: Pulau Kaniungan Besar cukup berdekatan dengan Biduk - biduk yang terkenal dengan danau labuan cerminnya. Dengan kapal klotok membutuhkan waktu sekitar 2 - 3 jam untuk sampai kesana. Pemandangannya indah dengan jumlah penduduk yang sedikit. Sayang ada beberapa bagian pantai yang karangnya sudah rusak, namun dilokasi yang bagus kita bisa snorkling sambil melihat ikan - ikan (termasuk clown fish / nemo) yang bermain di sarangnya. Ada satu titik yang merupakan lokasi yang bagus untuk melihat kemunculan mamalia laut bermain (Lumba - lumba / paus)

reviews.title: Distinctive looking mosque on riverfront
reviews.text:
This is quite a distinctive looking mosque and because it is by the river, it is quite a landmark. The mosque is green which is the peaceful colour, yellow domes and then there is a distinctive purple minaret. From here, there is the radio to broadcast the morning prayers. 
When one comes closer, it is a smaller mosque on a bigger compound and a side house. There is the main mosque building with intricate designs on the window. Some of the window also have a bit of stained glass effect.

address: RT 3 Kepulauan Derawan Derawan Dive Lodge, Berau 12345 Indonesia

reviews.title: Not up to expectation
reviews.text:
We dived with Tasik Divers at Derawan Dive Lodge every day for a week. Their dive boat is a bangka, like what you would find in Manado - large, stable, and comfortable. On the days that we had some weather it was nice to have the shelter. They always had tea and biscuits onboard, and lunch on the days we stayed out for three dives. The guides are supposedly trained in Manado. As we expected, they were great muck diving guides. However, their expertise seemed to end there. 

We dove nearby islands a few days that were walls and reefs and were mystified about how they ran those dives. Briefings were pretty much non-existent, even though we had a couple of inexperienced divers onboard. Several times they had the group swimming against the current for the entire dive - with no apparent purpose. Maybe they just kept misreading the current? A couple times the guides wanted us to swim into the shallows for a safety stop right where there was a washing machine current and waves breaking overhead. We refused and swam into the blue, but the divers that followed the guides got rather beat up. On a channel dive they dropped us in the middle of a channel on an incoming tide instead of on the wall where the predators always are. We saw nothing but bad visibility during that dive of course. And the manta dives at Sangalaki were pathetic. Big animals are never guaranteed, but the guides just wanted to aimlessly swim around rather than parking it at cleaning stations. 

The guides also seemed to have zero respect for the environment. They clawed the reef, scraped their fins on it, and said nothing to the divers that were doing the same or worse. 

We paid for Nitrox all week, but a couple times they gave us tanks that were only half full. Another couple that was traveling on the same itinerary as us had also requested Nitrox and only got it one day during the week we were there. Don't expect full service like you would receive in Manado or Lembeh. The guides leave your gear on the boat at night and don't bother washing anything. 

This area has promise and Tasik's other operations are good, so it's really quite a shame this one was so poorly run.

reviews.title: Remain the best Dive Center at Derawan Island
reviews.text:
If you want to make a dive trip with a different atmosphere and pleasant environment, it is no doubt to choose Tasik Divers as the top choice when creating the travel plan to Derawan island. The dive masters were very professional and friendly, cozy dive center, quiet and separated from the hustle of the village, giving an added value when resting after a dive during the day.

The cooking menu is also very tempting, coupled with the silence of the night accompanied by the sound of the pounding surf.

reviews.title: Excellent diving team
reviews.text: Good diving boat and equipment. Know the area well. They provide full transport from Berau airport (BEJ), 2.5 hours to Tanjung Batu continue with 30 minutes speed boat to Derawan Island.

reviews.title: Excellent Diving
reviews.text:
We booked the diving/snorkelling trip for the stay at the Lapatua Resort on Derawan Island (the diving office is located at the resort). E-Mail communication was quick and easy and all was organised when arrived for the next day diving. 
Did three dives and snorkelling at Kakaban jelly fish lake. 
Excellent boat, equipment and dive masters (we were 5 divers, 2 dive masters).
Thank you Christ, the manager of the dive centre for great service.

reviews.title: Quality Host Line
reviews.text:
brighten up special moment with hearty service the red borneo ,Berau - Kalimantan
My wife & me had a fantastic time at Derawan. The staffs & lodge is nothing less but fabulous. The dive guides & boat crews are..

reviews.title: Trip to Derawan
reviews.text: Although Tasik Divers had only recently started operations on Derawan I found the diving exceptional and the staff quite good and attentive.  I am sure over time it will get even better.  Diving with "stingless" jellies at Kakaban made for an even better experience but I would recommend that folks that go to Kakaban bring their dive boots as getting from the boat to the pathway on shore requires walking across coral.  I was the only one with boots on my trip and it made my trip infinitely easier then virtually everybody else's.

reviews.title: Epic and enjoyable trip.
reviews.text:
My hubby & me had a fantastic time at Derawan. The staffs & lodge is nothing less but fabulous. The dive guides & boat crews are professional and superseded our expectation.

*Elli was our group's guide on the 2nd day, was very meticulous with planning all our dives, especially at Maratua, Big Fish Country, he timed the dive so perfectly.

*Asman is another dive guide we felt that he went the extra mile. In Big Fish Country, the current was strong, he saw I did not have a reef-hook, he unselfishly gave his reef-hook to me. That made my day!

*Pehpeng, one of the fastest &efficient boat crew that we come across. Whether changing tanks in between dives or helping us up to the boat, we were very impressed by his level of service.

We both me agreed that all the time spent traveling to and fro Singapore and Derawan is worth it.

The only minor disappointment for me, when we were at Sangalaki, there was no Mantas. I was told that the last sighting was in February. 

Until then, keep up the good work!

reviews.title: An interesting place to know the history of Berau
reviews.text: A building of Sambaliung Sultanate is still well, but still need additional information boards to help visitors find the story and the story of the Sultanate Sambaliung. When we visited there was no single person who can be asked about the history and background as well as the story of the Sultanate Sambaliung.

reviews.title: Historical Site
reviews.text: In Jogjakarta have Keraton Jogja, in Berau we have Keraton Sambaliung. Its normally pretty quiet during the day as not many people visit this site often. Its a place that you can learn more about the history of Berau.

reviews.title: Friendly HIstoric Introduction of this area
reviews.text:
Keraton Sambaliung was built in 1810 by Sultan Alimuddin, also known as Raja Alam. It faces opposite Kelai riverbank and faces a nice picture of the Berau town with the houses on stilts. The palace is yellow, a mirror image of the Gunung Tabur Palace located opposite the river. The gate was closed when we came but it is open to the public so we just walked in. Admission is free. Staff inside are very welcoming and actually the person we talked to was the grandchild by wife no 13. They were very friendly, bringing us around and showing us photos of people who had come before. 
The total compound is 100 m by 40m. According to them, this is the most authentic palace around because a lot of them were bombed during the Japanese occupation. The last king had 13 wives and 57 children. There is a photo of President Jokowi with the son of the last king. The reception hall is big filled with the throne and pictures of important people. The harem is very big but completely empty now as the children have taken away most of the stuff.  They use to rear crocodiles here so there is a 7m stuffed crocodile in the garden. There is a meditation room on the second floor which is very peaceful.

reviews.title: Keraton Pecahan Kerajaan Berau
reviews.text: Keraton ini merupakan pecahan dari Kerajaan Gunung Tabur yang berada di seberang Sungai Segah akibat dari poligami Raja sebelumnya yang mempunyai keturunan dari istri pertama dan kedua. Di sini merupakan kerajaan dari putra yang lahir dari istri kedua. Kita bisa melihat berbagai peninggalan kerajaan yang masih tersimpan rapi di dalamnya.

reviews.title: Mengenal kehidupan kerajaan berau masa lampau
reviews.text: Museum ini sangat kaya akan sejarah kerajaan Berau yang juga di pengaruhi oleh Agama Islam. Sangat bagus untuk edukasi sejarah

reviews.title: Keraton Cantik yang Sarat Sejarah
reviews.text:
Keraton ini sangat menarik dan indah khas Kalimantan, bagi yang senang sejarah keraton ini jawabannya.
Didalamnya masih ada beberapa pakaian sultan, serta tidak ketinggalan beberapa peninggalan tua yang memiliki nilai luar biasa untuk bangsa Indonesia.
Keraton ini juga dijaga baik oleh keluarga kerajaan dan pemerintah setempat.

reviews.title: Keraton di tepi sungai
reviews.text: Keraton Sambaliung ini letaknya di tepi sungai Segah Berau. Cocoknya ke lokasi ini pagi2 sebelum jam 7 sambil lari pagi karena di depan keratin ini disediakan track lari dan view nya langsung ke sungai. Tapi keratonnya sendiri Nampak biasa saja

reviews.title: Sumur Belanda, mangrove dan bekantan
reviews.text:
Danau Sigending, atau Pulau Sigending, atau Pantai Sigending, mana yang lebih tepat saya kurang paham.... saya sebut saja Sigending yaa... 
Tempat eksotis ini dapat dicapai dari Biduk-biduk melalui pelabuhan Teluk Sulaiman. Dari Biduk-biduk ke Teluk Sulaiman jaraknya sekitar 6 km ke arah selatan, bisa ditempuh naik mobil seperempat jam, atau kalau lagi sehat dan siap, jalan kaki sekitar satu jam sambil lihat-lihat kampung nelayan.... 
Tiba di Teluk Sulaiman cari perahu sewaan yang mau ngantar ke Sigending... nego nego harga dikit lah... Lebih baik jika sudah order perahu malam sebelumnya. Saya dan rombongan 10 orang sewa perahu kayu kapasitas sampai 12 orang, tarif sewa 700 ribu untuk sehari penuh dari pagi sampai matahari terbenam. Seharian itu kami bisa ke Pulau Kaniungan Kecil, Pulau Kaniungan Besar, Teluk Sumbang, dan pulangnya ke Sigending. Bisa juga rutenya dibalik, Sigending duluan, tergantung air pasang surut lah... paling bagus masuk SIgending ketika air pasang naik maksimum.
Lihat apa di Sigending? Ada hutan bakau yang bagus di situ... kalau kita bisa berlabuh, jalan dikit... cari Sumur Belanda, air tawar (dari mata air karst, mungkin yaaa...) yang bisa bikin awet muda hahaha.... nah yang unik, di sini bisa hunting foto Bekantan, atau juga disebut Monyet Belanda, karena hidungnya yang gede kayak meneer Belanda hahaha..... Yang ini untung-untungan.... katanya kesempatan paling bagus di pagi hari jam 7-8, itulah waktunya para Bekantan mandi matahari, ceileeee.... siang sedikit mereka ogah kepanasan, pada sembunyi di pohon bakau. Air di sini bening banget, biru kehijauan, campuran antara asin dan tawar, mirip di Labuan Cermin lah. Bisa mandi-mandi di sini sampai puas.... kayak blue lagoon itu... Good luck & enjoy lah brow....

reviews.title: Danau tandingan Labuan Cermin
reviews.text: Danau ini memiliki kejernihan yang bisa di adu dengan Danau Labuan Cermin yang juga berada di Kecamatan yang sama. Posisi start dari Teluk Sulaiman dengan menggunakan transportasi darat sekitar 1 jam, dan tracking sekitar 5 menit. View bawah air sangat menawan dan patut di coba jika anda berkunjung ke biduk - biduk, khususnya teluk sulaiman.

reviews.title: " Air Terjun Yang Bikin Penasaran"
reviews.text:
" Te keder keder menuju Air Terjun Tambalang Berau".

â€ŒSebelum sampai di Berau,kak Mappasikra,kepala Dinas Pariwisata Berau mengirimkan video tentang air terjun di tengah hutan yg merupakan destinasi wisata yg baru di ekspose. Sangat menarik video yang ditampilkan.Sehingga rasanya sayang bila melewatkan kesempatan untuk main kesana, saya bersama kak Rawin Dongeng,yg saat itu mengisi materi Pelatihan di kecamatan Segah,ndak menolak saat Abi pemateri untuk bidang yg lain,mengajak mengunjungi air terjun tsb.Kaminberangkat setelah sholat Jumat,2 Maret 2018
ï¿¼
Jalan menuju ke lokasi air terjun cukup dekat dan bisa ditempuh dengan kendaraan.Walau masih jalan pengerasan,lumayan lah....kira kira 18 kiloan lah.
Lalu kami berhenti di plang air terjun dipinggir jalan.Tepat di depannya ada Dua orang bapak penduduk asli sedang duduk santai menikmati rambutan.
" Pak...kami ingin ke Air terjun,bagaimana caranya? ",Tanya saya.Lalu si bapak menjawab " Bisa aja.Rupanya yg saya tanya adalah nakhoda kapal Ketinting( kapal kayu kecil bermotor, berisi 5-8 orang).Hiks.
"Berapa orang ? bisa berenang?....".
Saya dan Bu Yayuk pucat pasi.Kami Ndak bisa berenang,lalu reflek saling berpandangan( kak Rawin cengengesan melihat kami berdua,ia anak sungai dan pastilah bisa berenang.Tapi kami Ndak mau tinggal .Pasti penasaranlah( lagian,mana berani kami tinggal di tengah hutan),mau ikutan takut resiko. Tapi pak nakhoda dengan tenang berkata" sudah naik aja". Siiiiiip lah.
Kami menunggu di dermaga yg rupanya baru dibuat.Agak nyeri begitu lihat sungai yg bakal kami lewati. Pohon pohon tumbang malang melintang di dasar sungai yg terlihat jelas Krn jernih. Ngek !
ï¿¼
â€ŒWajah kami masih ceria saat di dermaga.Tapi begitu kapal kecil yg kami naiki berbagai 8 termasuk Nakhoda mulai melintasi sungai, otomatis semua terdiam.Berzikir sebisanya.Dasar sungai terlihat jelas dan dekat, batang pohon besar yg melintang di tengah sungai ,batu batu besar yg menghadang.Tak terlihat rumah penduduk atau orang orang yg sedang memancing( seperti saat kami menelusuri sungai karang Mumus atau lagi Rafting di Sungai Ello).Nampak sekali alam yg masih asli seperti di film Anaconda.Huaaaaa....jadi inget film itu. Mata saya jelalatan melihat kira kanan atas bawah,kakao kalo ada binatang melata yg meluncur.Kak Rawin anak hulu Mahakam,menarik tangan saya agar tak memegang pinggir perahu. Saya jadi paham akan peringatan nya.
ï¿¼
Saya mengambil posisi duduk tepat di depan Nakhoda.heheh..cari aman.Dengan lincah Nakhoda melewati rintangan rintangan yg ada.Nampaknya ia sudah sangat hafal situasi di dalam sungai.
Perjalanan sungai kira kira 15 menit.Dan sampailah kami di dermaga Air Terjun Tambalang.Ohoooo....rupanya tidak langsung sampai. kami harus menelusuri hutan sepanjang 1500 meter.Melewati 3 jembatan batang kayu yg dibawahnya cukup dalam bila terjatuh
ï¿¼
Kalau teman teman pernah ke hutan Sungai Wain, Balikpapan, seperti itulah bentuk hutan yg kami lewati.Cukup Aman sih.Sudah ada petunjuk jalannya.Anggap aja kita sedang jogging siang hari,pasti sehat.Nikmati aja.
Akhirnya...sampailah kami di Air terjun nya. Wuaaah,segeeerr....airnya dingin.Kami menikmati nya. hilang semua lelah.Pemandangannya asyik. bahkan Abi dan Ari menaiki tebing air terjun.walau saya tau mereka pasti mikir kalau mau berenang.
ï¿¼
ï¿¼
ï¿¼
â€ŒSaya bergeser ketempat yg lebih landai untuk mencuci muka dan menjuntai kan kaki.Tapi....baru saja saya masukkan kaki,tiba tiba ada tiga titik hitam di kaki saya. Hiiiii... ternyata Lintah.Spontan saya meloncat histeris,karena saya memang paling takut sama lintah,apalagi lintah darat. Saat saya hentakkan kaki,dia lintah terjatuh,tapi yg satu belum . Rupanya sudah kadung mentransfer darah saya ke tubuhnya. titik kecil hitam itu langsung gendut.hiiiii.Untung didekat kak Rawin ada puntung rokok,ia langsung mengoleskan puntung itu ke kaki saya. Mood saya langsung hilang.
â€ŒSaat kami melihat jarum jam menunjukkan pukul 15.30, kami memutuskan kembali agar tidak kesorean.Kami kembali dg langkah yg gontai. Membayangkan 3 jembatan yg harus dilalui,jauhnya jarak tempuh,rasa lapar yg melanda.Lalu terdengar suara Azan. Subhanallah....di tengah hutan tak berpenghuni,ada suara Azan,membuat kami merasa aman. tiba tiba suara azan berhenti,saya terhenyak,kenapa?.... ternyata itu suara Hape mas Ari yg alarmnya bersuara azan. PHP nih.Langkah tak lagi mencari pijakan kering,ada becek,hajar aja,yg penting cepat sampai.Langkahpun sudah miring sana miring sini kayak robot.Abi di depan tetap memberi semangat, terutama kepada kami berdua. Besok masih ada 2 materi lagi yg harus kami selesaikan,jadi,jangan tumbang.
ï¿¼
Akhirnya, sampailah kami di dermaga,dan ternyata pak nakhoda tak ada ditempat.Kami sempat menunggu selama 30 menit.Terasa sangat lama,kala kami memandang sekeliling hutan.Imajinasi saya bisa berkembang macam macam bila pak Nakhoda tak segera datang.Bisa bisa saya membayangkan seekor buaya besar keluar dari lobang gua.Hayah !
Untung ada ikan kecil kecil yg menghibur kami.Dengan jelas ikan ikan ini menghampiri kami saat ditaburi roti.
Alhamdulillah.
Akhirnya, jemputan kami tiba.Kembali kami melintasi sungai untuk kembali ke tempat kami meninggalkan kendaraan kami.Alhamdulilah....Masih teringat tulisan di dalam yg kami baca " Jangan ambil apapun ,kecuali gambar,Jangan tinggalkan apapun kecuali jejak. Ada lagi kata kata yg lucu" lupakan saja mantan kamu,tapi jangan lupapakan sampah yang kamu tinggalkan".
Perjalanan yg tak terlupakan.Mungkin tulisan ini bisa memberikan manfaat,atau paling tidak kita lebih siap dlm saat akan menuju kesana.Kira kira gini:
1.Lebih tepat untuk wisata petualangan,jangan pake pantofel atau sepatu hak tinggi
2.Bisa berenang atau bawa pelampung.Dipake atau enggak,pokoknya siapin.
3.Bawa P3K,karena di dlm ngga ada dokter atau puskesmas
4.Amankan dirimu Krn tidak ada petugas keamanan
5. Bawa Korek api ,makanan ringan secukupnya dan minuman secukupnya ( jangan nyusahin orang dg bawaannya)
6. Rancang kegiatanmu di sana,dan hitung waktu saat beraktifitas,jangan kesorean.
7.Nampaknya bisa untuk berkemah,tapi pastikan penerangan dan keamanan saat berkemah,tidak disarankan untuk perempuan berkemah disana.
8. Pakai pakaian yg nyaman,kaos dan celana lapangan.Jangan pake Jas atau baju pesta.Jangan lupa pakai sepatu Kets yg tertutup dan pakai topi.
Dinikmati yaaaah.....perjalanannya. hehehe. Salam........
ï¿¼

reviews.title: Small park in the middle of a crowded town
reviews.text:
This is quite a small park in front of the Walikota office. It is nice to have a small garden to walk around especially during the evenings when all the families with young children to come for walk. The park is small but its nice to have somewhere to go. It is also a little cheesy because there are fake deer, elephant etc statues scattered around the park. There is also a small fountain. 
It is located next to a tennis court but unfortunately its only for government officials so the public cannot rent an office there.

reviews.title: Taman pusat kota
reviews.text: Taman cendana, adalah salah satu tempat menghilangkan penat dipusat kota tanjung redeb, dekat dengan pusat pemerintahan dan sarana olahraga di sekelilingnya

reviews.title: Taman Depan Kantor Bupati Berau
reviews.text: Taman ini terletak di depan kantor Bupati Berau. Ukurannya tidak terlalu besar namun ditumbuhi pepohonan rindang dan ada beberapa patung binatang seperti gajah, jerapah, dan harimau. Rerumputannya masih hijau terawat dengan baik, demikian pula dengan pepohonannya. Taman ini cocok untuk berolahraga pagi atau sore hari seperti jogging, tapi sebaiknya tidak menginjak rumput.

reviews.title: Explore Berau
reviews.text:
Bandara Tanjung redeb jd tanah yg pertama di injak, ngopi pkus isap sisa di pinggir sungai tepatnya cafe pak andi, esoknya cus ke tanjung batu. Perjalanan 30 menit langsung sampe pulau derawan. Penyu hewan yg menarik perhatian waktu snorkling....
Oiya, soal kuliner... sop ikannya mantep bgt. Coba deh

reviews.title: Tempat terbaik untuk olah raga lari di Tanjung Redeb
reviews.text:
Masih menjadi tempat yang terbaik pada saat ini, karena tidak ada tempat serupa di kota Tanjung Redeb untuk dapat berolahraga lari, baik di pagi maupun sore hari.

Meskipun tidak terlalu luas dan besar, namun lintasan lari berkeliling Taman Candana sepanjang 330 meter sudah cukup memadai.

reviews.title: Tempat untuk lari pagi
reviews.text: seperti taman pemerintah pada umumnya. dengan fasilitas standard. tapi lumayan untuk lokasi lari pagi. Jika sudah sampai sini, lebih baik diteruskan lari sampai ke Sungai Segah
